page.title: 12HOME LIFE
page.content: Lunnon cottage was built in the middle of the 16th. Century and was a traditional two room cottage with a central passage and a loft. Lunnon is a corruption of London and the area of the parish of Rushock is known as Little London. This name is used for a pocket of population away from the main settlement. The owners of Lunnon cottage are considered 'newcomers' within the parish because they have only been resident since September 1981. Although the cottage was inhabited they have installed a damp course, rewired it and added central heating. The cottage is now an idyllic black and white one, surrounded by a beautiful garden which contains many shrubs, a pool and a small area of mixed woodland.
